Package org.forgerock.openam.utils

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.utils.StringUtils
  • public final class StringUtils
extends Object
    Utility class for handling Strings.

                             Map<String,​String> tagSwapMap)
        Swaps content with tags with the provided tag values.
        Parameters:
        content - The String content to be replaced
        tagSwapMap - A map containing the replacable tokens with their new values
        Returns:
        the tagswapped String content

                                   int position,
                                   String content)
        Inserted content into a string.
        Parameters:
        original - The original string.
        position - The insertion position.
        content - The content to insert.
        Returns:

      • getParameter

        public static List<String> getParameter​(String list,
                                        String delimiter,
                                        String parameterName)
        Takes a list as a String (where each element is of the form name=value) and returns the value specified by parameterName (if it exists).
        Parameters:
        list - The list e.g. a=1,b=2,c=5
        delimiter - The delimiter used to separate the elements (e.g. ",")
        parameterName - The name of the parameter to return
        Returns:
        The value(s) specified by parameterName

      • ifNullOrEmpty

        public static String ifNullOrEmpty​(String original,
                                   String defaultString)
        Checks that the original string is not null nor empty, if so it returns the non-null default string instead.
        Parameters:
        original - the original string
        defaultString - the non-null default string
        Returns:
        the original string if not null and not empty, else the default string

      • encodeURIComponent

        public static String encodeURIComponent​(String component,
                                        String encoding)
                                 throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Encodes the passed String using an algorithm that's compatible with JavaScript's encodeURIComponent function. Returns null if the String is null.
        Parameters:
        component - String to be encoded.
        encoding - The name of character encoding.
        Returns:
        the same value as JavaScript encodeURIComponent function
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException - If the named encoding is not supported

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty​(String s)
        Determines if the string is empty.
        Parameters:
        s - string to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified string is null or zero length.

      • isBlank

        public static boolean isBlank​(String s)
        Determines if the string is blank.
        Parameters:
        s - string to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified string is null or when trimmed is empty (i.e. when trimmed it has zero length)

      • isNotEmpty

        public static boolean isNotEmpty​(String s)
        Determines if the string is not empty.
        Parameters:
        s - string to test
        Returns:
        test if the specified string is not null and not empty (i.e. is greater than zero length).

      • isNotBlank

        public static boolean isNotBlank​(String s)
        Determines if the string is not blank.
        Parameters:
        s - string to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified string is not null and when trimmed has greater than zero length.

      • isAnyBlank

        public static boolean isAnyBlank​(Set<String> xs)
        Tests whether any string in the given set is blank.
        Parameters:
        xs - the set of strings.
        Returns:
        true if the set is null or empty or if any member of the set is blank.
        See Also:
        isBlank(String)

      • isEqualTo

        public static boolean isEqualTo​(String s1,
                                String s2)
        Compare two strings for equality.
        Parameters:
        s1 - first string to compare.
        s2 - second string to compare.
        Returns:
        true if strings are equal or they are both null.

      • compareCaseInsensitiveString

        public static boolean compareCaseInsensitiveString​(String s1,
                                                   String s2)
        Compares two strings in a case insensitive manner, that also allows for either of the strings to be null, without issue.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first string to be compared.
        s2 - the second string to tbe compared.
        Returns:
        true if the parameter values are the same, false if different.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains​(String s1,
                               String s2)
        Check if one string contains another string.
        Parameters:
        s1 - The string to check in.
        s2 - The string to check for.
        Returns:
        False if either string is null or if the first does not contain the second, otherwise true.

      • containsCaseInsensitive

        public static boolean containsCaseInsensitive​(String s1,
                                              String s2)
        Check if one string contains another string in a case insensitive manner.
        Parameters:
        s1 - The string to check in.
        s2 - The string to check for.
        Returns:
        False if either string is null or if the first does not contain the second, otherwise true.

      • startsWith

        public static boolean startsWith​(String s1,
                                 String s2)
        Check if one string starts with another string.
        Parameters:
        s1 - The string to check in.
        s2 - The string to check for.
        Returns:
        False if either string is null or if the first does not start with the second, otherwise true.

      • match

        public static boolean match​(String value,
                            String strPattern)
        Match the value to the regular expression pattern. The pattern given can contain a file name like search, e.g. '*service*', which will be converted to a valid regular expression, e.g. '.*?service.*'.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to match on.
        strPattern - The pattern to match.
        Returns:
        True if the value matches the pattern, false otherwise.

      • split

        public static List<String> split​(String content,
                                 Pattern pattern)
        Splits a string into a list of elements by a pattern.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to split into a list of elements.
        pattern - the regular expression to use to split elements.
        Returns:
        the list of elements, or an empty list if the content was null.
